ACT
92
The right of the heir to which the gift or legatee is not taken into account
When, according to the testator's will, the gift or legacy should not be included in the heir's share of the inheritance, such an heir retains the gift or legacy and participates with the other heirs in the division of the estate, as if there had been no gift or legacy.
When there are necessary heirs, and according to the will of the testator, the gift or legacy should not be included in any heir's inheritance, that heir has the right to keep the gift or legacy to the extent that this does not prevent the necessary heir from receiving the full value of the necessary part.
